comment: The class is easy but the professor makes it difficult for no reason. One assignment will affect your entire grade. She grades with no feedback. She says she'll get back to you in 24 hrs but doesn't respond.

As long as you do the work, you'll be fine. Professor Wertz is a kind professor and I'm pretty sure she graded mainly based on whether you did the assignment. The only issue with this class is that there are 11 assignments in total, so if you don't do one or make a bad grade it will affect your entire grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I actually liked this class and it had a lot of different stuff from my other pr classes. Wertzes classes are easy to follow and she is really helpful. There are discussion posts a weekly assignment, a couple tests and a short paper. Will definitely take her again if I can
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: This class is an elective class that she makes difficult for no reason. She gives small lectures then expects you to teach yourself from a long chapter. The tests are lockdown with webcam and the most specific questions that are irrelevant. She is a pretty easy grader on discussions and quizzes but I would take someone else if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I've taken this professor for two courses now, and can easily say that her class is the best. For International PR, you read the chapter, create a 5 question quiz and do a discussion post. The discussion posts do require a lot of thought and time, but if you give it the time it deserves you'll easily do well in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I HATED the group project because it lasted the whole semester. However I liked her teaching style and if you are on top of the chapter readings and discussion posts, it not too bad of a class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr Wertz is so nice and is very knowledgeable. Easy chapter assignments every week. One group presentation for the whole semester. 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: LOVE her. I was nervous ab this class at first bc it was 4wks & I took 3 other classes, but it ended up being totally fine. listen to the lectures, read, do the discussions, & ur fine. She's so willing to help with anything you need and grades VERY fair. I would take her again for sure. definitely recommend even though it was sorta a lot of work!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Took this as a 4wk sum. class. I pulled all-nighters 4 days/wk bc of the amount of reading but also am taking 3 other classes. Use the SG for tests, do the discussions, read & ur fine. She's SO accessible & willing to help with anything. It seems like a lot/hard but it's rly not. I would absolutely take her again!!! one of my favorite profs now!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: GReat teacher. I took this class in 4 weeks last summer. It was a lot but easy at the same time. If you try at all. Follow the syllabus and use her study guide. You have plenty of time for the last paper. It was a pretty fun class and I got an A. Dr. Wertz was cool and helpful. good choice for summer online class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: While some people complained about discussions being time-consuming. they were also the ones that waited till Sunday to start. The work she has you do will genuinely contribute to your worldview knowledge and helpful to her exams. The group project was easy to understand and she gives great feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Ive had Dr. Wertz for PR 3335 and 4460 too and enjoyed having her for all. Im hoping to take her for campaigns. Her feedback is fast and clear and she actually cares about your projects and grade. PR 3385 has discussions that are pretty creative. Tests are hard so use the study guide. She answered all my questions on the paper we wrote
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Wertz is an excellent professor. She provides good feedback on all assignments and grades things very quickly. I have no clue why people here are so hard on her - she's not bad at all. Class was a lot of weekly discussions, two exams (with lockdown), and a big group project. It's a lot of work, but easy to pass if you put in effort.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: My 3rd class with Wertz. Love her teaching style . She grades fast with a lot of good feedback. The group project seems like a lot but she breaks it down and met with our group when we had some questions. the plan we did helped get my internship. Get ready to read and work. The class is pretty interesting and it paid off
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: This professor is crazy picky about all of her assignments despite very unclear instructions on everything throughout the course. Discussions are tedious and unnecessary, and take up a decent amount of time. Group project is confusing and she is unhelpful. She isn't the worst professor I have had, but there are definitely better options out there.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I took as a 4 week summer class, was very fast-moving and the tests were tough but if you keep up with the reading and smaller grades/ weekly homeworks, it helps a lot. She is a fair grader and clearly outlines requirements and due dates. overall good professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: This woman does not operate as if she wants you to pass. I took her for a 4 week summer class and there were about 5 chapters a week, 2 assignments per chapter, and a test each week. Her lectures had little information because she expects you to read each long chapter. If you're taking her in the summer or online, good luck to you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Tests are lockdown broswer with webcam, but she gives a study guide for each that helps outline the key information you need to know for the test without spoonfeeding you. There's a group project you start a little before the middle of the semester, and the group is assigned to you. Just follow the guidance given in class and you should be fine!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Dr. Wertz does weekly quizes that you make up, answer and send to her. Those were great. However, her tests are extremely difficult. She'll tell you to study a total of 30 topics and only like 2 will be on the test along with information that you didn't go over on the lectures and info that isn't in the book. Only 2 tests & on lockdown browser.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I found this class very interesting, but it was tough. The tests were pretty hard. Make sure you buy the book, you need it. You a semester long group project. It's not too hard, but you will have to spend a good bit of time on it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Wertz is great, but this class is pretty time consuming. The discussion posts are longggg so set aside an hour or two to do them. The tests were hard in my opinion. Her study guide helps, but it not everything you need. The semester long group project is fine if you have a good group. I did not, so it was difficult for me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Wertz is an amazing professor. She gives real life examples to go along with her lectures & has a passion for crisis communication. I highly recommend taking her. The semester long project is not hard & she breaks it up to make it easier on you & your group. Her discussion posts are time consuming but not hard if you actually read. Love her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor! Final project is NOT as stressful or as difficult as you think it is, I promise. The discussion board posts will take you about an hour so don't wait till Sunday. But if you do your work you'll really be fine. She's a great teacher, easy to talk to and very relatable. Would recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: Werts is great professor. She has real world experience and gives great examples in Crisis Com. The class is two tests, 10 discussion posts, and a group project. She assigns the group so you just have to make it work but my group was great.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Wertz is cool. The class is group heavy and requires you to do several D2L discussion posts that are time-consuming-- but the work itself is not too hard at all. She is available for questions and help and she is very understanding. Would for sure take Wertz again.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She's a decent professor, but she can come off a little condescending at times. Not a hard class, but the discussion posts are SO time-consuming! Work on them throughout the week instead of waiting to do them all on Sunday.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: There is a huge semester long project that you do with a group, and it is a good bit of work but after it is done, you realize you have learned a ton about the subject. Very useful class, great teacher. She does not lecture about useless stuff, she is there for constructive criticism and wants her students to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Wertz is a decent professor. Her teaching style isn't the very best and she is a tough grader. The tests are easy, as long as you study but the discussion posts can be tough to answer since she grades for more than completion. It is an easy A for most students but if you have a serious interest in this subject, I would recommend someone else.

I took this as a hybrid. A couple of (easy) tests, weekly (time consuming) discussions, and a big group project. If you've got a good group, the project is extremely simple and not hard at all. Wertz is cool af; to the point and I love her teaching style overall. I'd absolutely take her again.

The class is a breeze, if you show up, you'll be fine. You won't learn anything, but you'll get an A as long as you do the work and do the discussions.  Everything is just busy work and do not miss anything because even with an excuse, you won't be able to make anything up.  She comes off nice but DOESNT believe in any kind of extenuating circumsta

She is a great teacher, passionate about what she teaches & applies it in a way that is understandable. There are quizzes that you make based on each chapter, in class assignments & 3 exams. If you read & take good notes in her class you will do great. Warning: you cannot check out of her class & expect to get a good grade! I would take her again!

Took as a hybrid. 2 tests, 25 questions each, fairly easy. Majority of grade comes from weekly discussion posts online and big group project/paper due at the end. Wasn't a fun class, but wasn't too difficult either. Online discussion posts were graded pretty roughly, students lost a lot of points on them- they can easily bring down your grade

I think Mrs. Wertz has a great demeanor and I enjoyed her lectures and examples. Its obvious that she enjoys the company of her students and it makes her company enjoyable as well. The tests were a bit tricky (but not impossible) but I blame this mostly on the textbook we used.  However,  I think the enjoyable classroom experience makes up for it.

Not a huge fan of Dr. Wertz. The each test was over 5 chapters and she didn't provide a study guide or any hint about what would be on the test. This was a tough class for most of the people I talked to.

She is a awesome teacher! I had for PR principles over the summer also. I would have her for every class if i could. She knows her stuff and talks to you like your a professional not a student. She makes the class fun and is always wiling to help. Work hard cause she gives you the grade you deserve. Love her.
I have taken Dr. Wertz twice and LOVE her!  She makes boring material much more interesting.  Attendance is mandatory and you should definitely study for her tests.  Easy A.

If you do the work, you will get an A.  Her tests are timed so you will need to study.  I really like her.  She is extremely knowledgable.  Go to class.  She expects a level of maturity and professionalism in her class.  She does not like excuses. So don't make any.
Was one of the BEST PROFESSOR at Kennesaw State University and she has a background in PR.
Dr. Wertz is very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. She uses examples that are close to our reality and easy to relate. She made the class fun
Dr. Wertz is a great professor, I really enjoyed her style of teaching. Super helpful & knowledgeable about PR!
